title: Undertaker
data:
[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Funeral director](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funeral_director "wikipedia:Funeral director")***

The **Undertaker** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") in the variant [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). Undertakers are knowledgeable about all things related to [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"), including the use of [wands of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning") and [tinning kits](/wiki/Tinning_kit "Tinning kit").

They are lawful or neutral, and can be a human, elf, dwarf, gnome, hobbit, nymph or kobold.

The Undertaker first appeared in an early version of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") ([NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10")) but was dropped from the code at the time the [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branch was ported into that variant. The role was later revived and given a quest in SlashTHEM.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Skills](#Skills)
- [2 Techniques](#Techniques)
- [3 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [4 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)
- [5 Rank titles](#Rank_titles)
- [6 Quest](#Quest)
- [7 Gods](#Gods)
- [8 History](#History)
- [9 References](#References)

## Skills

NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), which predated the [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") system, so Undertakers could use any weapons. SlashTHEM gives the Undertaker a skill set closer to that of the [Necromancer](/wiki/Necromancer "Necromancer") and [Undead Slayer](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer"):

| Undertaker skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ----------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max               | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Basic             | - *Weapons:* [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [javelin](/wiki/Javelin "Javelin"), [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident"), [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")
- *Combat:* [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")
- *Spells:* [matter](/wiki/Matter_spells "Matter spells") |
| Skilled           | * *Weapons:* [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling")
* *Spells:* [protection](/wiki/Protection_spells "Protection spells"), [body](/wiki/Body_spells "Body spells")                                                    |
| Expert            | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")                                                                                                       |

The Undertaker's [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") is [turn undead](/wiki/Spellbook_of_turn_undead "Spellbook of turn undead"). Spell success is determined by [wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom").

- SlashTHEM u\_init.c line 2244 in v. 0.8

## Techniques

- XL 1: [Turn undead](/wiki/Turn_undead "Turn undead")

SlashTHEM tech.c line 287 in v. 0.8

## Intrinsics

- XL 1: [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- XL 7: [Cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance")

## Starting equipment

- A +2 [scalpel](/wiki/Scalpel "Scalpel")
- A +0 [expensive suit](/wiki/Expensive_suit "Expensive suit")
- A [wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning")
- A [tinning kit](/wiki/Tinning_kit "Tinning kit")
- A [brass lantern](/wiki/Brass_lantern "Brass lantern")
- A +0 pick-axe

Their starting [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is a [death dog](/wiki/Death_dog "Death dog").

SLASHTHEM role.c line 245 in v. 0.8

## Rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- XL 1-2: Hearse Driver
- XL 3-5: Disposer
- XL 6-9: Grave Creator
- XL 10-13: Open Casketeer
- XL 14-17: Closed Casketeer
- XL 18-21: Dumper
- XL 22-25: Shoveler
- XL 26-29: Crematorist
- XL 30: Corpse Burner

SlashTHEM role.c line 1511 in v. 0.8

## Quest

- *Main article: [Undertaker quest](/index.php?title=Undertaker_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Undertaker quest (page does not exist)")*

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"maps"*

The quest sees the Undertaker fighting the [Seducer Saint](/index.php?title=Seducer_Saint\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Seducer Saint (page does not exist)") for the [Pick of the Grave](/index.php?title=Pick_of_the_Grave\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pick of the Grave (page does not exist)"), a neutral [life-draining](/index.php?title=Life-drain\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Life-drain (page does not exist)") [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") which grants [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") while worn and [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration"), [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage") and [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control") while carried([Black Death](/index.php?title=Black_Death\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Black Death (page does not exist)") is now an ordinary artifact halberd that can be given as a [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") or found randomly generated). Invoking the Pick [blesses](/wiki/Bless "Bless") it, repairs any damage and [erodeproofs](/wiki/Erodeproof "Erodeproof") it, and raises its enchantment to +3. This effect cannot be used while the Pick is equipped, however, so this is not a way to free your weapon hand if the Pick gets cursed while wielded. Random monster generation is biased towards [nalfeshnees](/wiki/Nalfeshnee "Nalfeshnee"), [pit fiends](/wiki/Pit_fiends "Pit fiends") and other demons.

- SlashTHEM artilist.h line 610 in v. 0.8
- SlashTHEM artifact.c line 2121 in v. 0.8

## Gods

The Undertaker's pantheon combines death-related gods from Norse, Greek, and Roman mythology:

- Lawful: Hel
- Neutral: Pluto
- Chaotic: [Orcus](/wiki/Orcus_\(god\) "Orcus (god)")

## History

The Undertaker's first appearance was in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") precursor [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"), as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in [the contemporary version of NetHack](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"). The discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet. See [here](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/rec.games.hack/jg8YtQX1M3Y/tbBlteXdYY8J) for the relevant post.

After the release of [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3") in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to [NetHack-- 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack--_3.1.3 "NetHack-- 3.1.3") by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version. Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack. Most significantly, NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branch. To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.

The Undertaker role, along with the other eight new roles in NetHack-- 3.0.10, made its reappearance in the variant SlashTHEM.

## References

- NetHack-- 3.0.10 attrib.c line 104
- NetHack-- 3.0.10 u\_init.c line 206

Undertaker

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Wikipedia has an article about:
Funeral director

The Undertaker is a role in the variant SlashTHEM. Undertakers are knowledgeable about all things related to corpses, including the use of wands of undead turning and tinning kits.

They are lawful or neutral, and can be a human, elf, dwarf, gnome, hobbit, nymph or kobold.

The Undertaker first appeared in an early version of SLASH'EM (NetHack-- 3.0.10) but was dropped from the code at the time the quest branch was ported into that variant. The role was later revived and given a quest in SlashTHEM.

Contents

  • 1 Skills
  • 2 Techniques
  • 3 Intrinsics
  • 4 Starting equipment
  • 5 Rank titles
  • 6 Quest
  • 7 Gods
  • 8 History
  • 9 References

Skills

NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on NetHack 3.0.10, which predated the skill system, so Undertakers could use any weapons. SlashTHEM gives the Undertaker a skill set closer to that of the Necromancer and Undead Slayer:

Undertaker skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: mace, spear, javelin, trident, shuriken
  • Combat: bare hands
  • Spells: matter
Skilled
  • Weapons: axe, club, polearms, sling
  • Spells: protection, body
Expert
  • Weapons: dagger, knife, pick-axe, quarterstaff, dart

The Undertaker's special spell is turn undead. Spell success is determined by wisdom.

  • SlashTHEM u_init.c line 2244 in v. 0.8

Techniques

  • XL 1: Turn undead

SlashTHEM tech.c line 287 in v. 0.8

Intrinsics

  • XL 1: Poison resistance
  • XL 7: Cold resistance

Starting equipment

  • A +2 scalpel
  • A +0 expensive suit
  • A wand of undead turning
  • A tinning kit
  • A brass lantern
  • A +0 pick-axe

Their starting pet is a death dog.

SLASHTHEM role.c line 245 in v. 0.8

Rank titles

The status line shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

  • XL 1-2: Hearse Driver
  • XL 3-5: Disposer
  • XL 6-9: Grave Creator
  • XL 10-13: Open Casketeer
  • XL 14-17: Closed Casketeer
  • XL 18-21: Dumper
  • XL 22-25: Shoveler
  • XL 26-29: Crematorist
  • XL 30: Corpse Burner

SlashTHEM role.c line 1511 in v. 0.8

Quest

Main article: Undertaker quest

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"maps"

The quest sees the Undertaker fighting the Seducer Saint for the Pick of the Grave, a neutral life-draining pick-axe which grants cold resistance while worn and regeneration, half physical damage and teleport control while carried(Black Death is now an ordinary artifact halberd that can be given as a sacrifice gift or found randomly generated). Invoking the Pick blesses it, repairs any damage and erodeproofs it, and raises its enchantment to +3. This effect cannot be used while the Pick is equipped, however, so this is not a way to free your weapon hand if the Pick gets cursed while wielded. Random monster generation is biased towards nalfeshnees, pit fiends and other demons.

  • SlashTHEM artilist.h line 610 in v. 0.8
  • SlashTHEM artifact.c line 2121 in v. 0.8

Gods

The Undertaker's pantheon combines death-related gods from Norse, Greek, and Roman mythology:

  • Lawful: Hel
  • Neutral: Pluto
  • Chaotic: Orcus

History

The Undertaker's first appearance was in SLASH'EM precursor NetHack-- 3.0.10, as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in the contemporary version of NetHack. The discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet. See here for the relevant post.

After the release of NetHack 3.1.3 in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to NetHack-- 3.1.3 by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version. Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack. Most significantly, NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the Quest branch. To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.

The Undertaker role, along with the other eight new roles in NetHack-- 3.0.10, made its reappearance in the variant SlashTHEM.

References

  • NetHack-- 3.0.10 attrib.c line 104
  • NetHack-- 3.0.10 u_init.c line 206

{{wikipedia|Funeral director}}

The '''Undertaker''' is a [[role]] in the variant [[SlashTHEM]]. Undertakers are knowledgeable about all things related to [[corpse]]s, including the use of [[wand of undead turning|wands of undead turning]] and [[tinning kit]]s.

They are lawful or neutral, and can be a human, elf, dwarf, gnome, hobbit, nymph or kobold.

The Undertaker first appeared in an early version of [[SLASH'EM]] ([[NetHack-- 3.0.10]]) but was dropped from the code at the time the [[quest]] branch was ported into that variant.  The role was later revived and given a quest in SlashTHEM.

==Skills==
NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on [[NetHack 3.0.10]], which predated the [[skill]] system, so Undertakers could use any weapons. 
SlashTHEM gives the Undertaker a skill set closer to that of the [[Necromancer]] and [[Undead Slayer]]:
<!-- +Exp pick/knife -->
{| class="prettytable"
! colspan="2" style="font-size:larger" | Undertaker skills
|-
! Max !! Skills
|-
| Basic
|
* ''Weapons:'' [[mace]], [[spear]], [[javelin]], [[trident]], [[shuriken]]
* ''Combat:'' [[bare hands]]
* ''Spells:'' [[matter spells|matter]]
|-
| Skilled
|
* ''Weapons:'' [[axe]], [[club]], [[polearms]], [[sling]]
* ''Spells:'' [[protection spells|protection]], [[body spells|body]]
|-

|}

The Undertaker's [[special spell]] is [[spellbook of turn undead|turn undead]].  Spell success is determined by [[wisdom]].

*SlashTHEM u_init.c line 2244 in v. 0.8

==Techniques==

SlashTHEM tech.c line 287 in v. 0.8

==Intrinsics==

* XL 7: [[Cold resistance]]

* A +2 [[scalpel]]
* A +0 [[expensive suit]]
* A [[wand of undead turning]]
* A [[tinning kit]]
* A [[brass lantern]]
* A +0 pick-axe

Their starting [[pet]] is a [[death dog]].

SLASHTHEM role.c line 245 in v. 0.8

==Rank titles==
The [[status line]] shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified [[experience level]]:

* XL 1-2: Hearse Driver
* XL 3-5: Disposer

* XL 10-13: Open Casketeer

==Quest==
{{main|Undertaker quest}}
{{todo|maps}}

The quest sees the Undertaker fighting the [[Seducer Saint]] for the [[Pick of the Grave]], a neutral [[life-drain]]ing [[pick-axe]] which grants [[cold resistance]] while worn and [[regeneration]], [[half physical damage]] and [[teleport control]] while carried([[Black Death]] is now an ordinary artifact halberd that can be given as a [[sacrifice gift]] or found randomly generated). Invoking the Pick [[bless]]es it, repairs any damage and [[erodeproof]]s it, and raises its enchantment to +3.  This effect cannot be used while the Pick is equipped, however, so this is not a way to free your weapon hand if the Pick gets cursed while wielded.
Random monster generation is biased towards [[nalfeshnee]]s, [[pit fiends]] and other demons.

* SlashTHEM artilist.h line 610 in v. 0.8
* SlashTHEM artifact.c line 2121 in v. 0.8

==Gods==
The Undertaker's pantheon combines death-related gods from Norse, Greek, and Roman mythology:

* Lawful: Hel
* Neutral: Pluto
* Chaotic: [[Orcus (god)|Orcus]]

==History==
The Undertaker's first appearance was in [[SLASH'EM]] precursor [[NetHack-- 3.0.10]], as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in [[NetHack 3.0.10|the contemporary version of NetHack]]. The discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet. See [https://groups.google.com/d/msg/rec.games.hack/jg8YtQX1M3Y/tbBlteXdYY8J here] for the relevant post.

After the release of [[NetHack 3.1.3]] in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to [[NetHack-- 3.1.3]] by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version.  Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, some content was removed to improve compatibility with NetHack. Most significantly, NetHack 3.1 had seen the addition of the [[Quest]] branch. To avoid the challenge of fitting full-length quests for the roles that had been added in NetHack-- 3.0.10 into the patch code, those roles were simply left out of the patch.

The Undertaker role, along with the other eight new roles in NetHack-- 3.0.10, made its reappearance in the variant SlashTHEM.
